text:
Diet and Nutrition
Living with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) means paying special attention to what you eat. Maintaining good nutrition can be a balancing act. Learn how to stay on the right track.
Crohn's & Colitis Congress 2024
January 25-27: The premier conference for IBD professionals is headed to the Bellagio in Las Vegas, NV. Discover the latest treatments and leave with practical information you can immediately apply.
Clinical Trials
Many people with IBD are unaware that clinical trials are an option. Through clinical trials, researchers find new ways to improve treatments and quality of life.
MyIBD Learning Education Programs
Throughout 2023, the Crohn’s & Colitis Foundation is hosting virtual, in-person, and on demand MyIBD Learning education programs. Each program is created for patients and caregivers of all ages—wherever they are in their patient journey.
Featured Study Opportunities
Any promotion below of studies listed on the Foundation’s Featured Study Opportunities page are paid for by the study sponsor (or affiliates).
This promotion does not imply recommendation or favor of the Foundation, as the Crohn’s & Colitis Foundation does not endorse any particular study.
If you are interested in participating in a study, the Foundation recommends that you consult with your healthcare professional first.

Crohn's & Colitis Foundation
The Crohn's & Colitis Foundation is a non-profit, volunteer-fueled organization dedicated to finding the cures for
[Crohn's disease](/what-is-crohns-disease) and [ulcerative colitis](/what-is-ulcerative-colitis), and to improving the quality of life of children and adults affected by these diseases. It was founded in 1967 by Irwin M. and Suzanne Rosenthal, William D. and Shelby Modell, and Henry D. Janowitz, M.D.
